definition: niche for statue (esp. Buddhist, Christian etc)

sentences.english: The mother and child manual taken to find out from the drawer of niche for Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 帶着從佛龕的抽屜中找到的母子手冊。

sentences.english: Nearby residents witnessed the behavior of the couple dropped shrines, then alarm.
sentences.chinese: 附近的居民目擊該夫婦丟棄佛龕的行爲，隨即報警。

sentences.english: There is a "medicinal" boar fetus in a jar of alcohol displayed near a small Buddhist shrine.
sentences.chinese: 佛龕旁邊放着一瓶藥酒，裏面泡的是野豬的胚胎。

sentences.english: A Buddhist shrine stands on the other side of the room, but the candles have burned out.
sentences.chinese: 而對面的佛龕上，長明燈已然熄滅。

sentences.english: This niche is delicately made of fine-quality rosewood with refined craftsmanship.
sentences.chinese: 此佛龕選用優質紫檀精製而成，工藝精湛。

sentences.english: There is a “medicinal” boar fetus in a jar of alcohol displayed near a small Buddhist shrine.
sentences.chinese: 佛龕旁邊放着一瓶藥酒，裏面泡的是野豬的胚胎。

sentences.english: Almost every religious family has a small sutra recitation hall or a niche for a Buddhist statue.
sentences.chinese: 信教者家中幾乎都設有小經堂或佛龕。

definition: Mt Maiji Caves at Tianshui 天水, Gansu
Maitreya/the Bodhisattva that will be the next to come after Shakyamuni Buddha
white marble/a type of white marble used for building and sculpting
dining hall in a Buddhist temple
Hall of Great Strength, main hall of a Buddhist temple containing the main image of veneration 大雄[da4 xiong2]
volumes of classics/volumes of scriptures/ancient scrolls
